Issues.Title: Better support for running angular builds in parallel (ngcc problems)
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

compiler-cli

### Description

**Context:** 
I'm working on a multi angular applications project. I am using Gradle & yarn workspaces to produce an environment and pipeline where I can build multiple (independant) angular applications.

**Problem:**
Despite running `ngcc` manually before running my builds I still run into problems as `ng build` triggers `ngcc` regardless (even if it ends up doing nothing *output below) and tries to obtain locks.

> `ngcc` output during build
```
Another process, with id 574177, is currently running ngcc.
Waiting up to 250s for it to finish.
(If you are sure no ngcc process is running then you should delete the lock-file at [REDACTED]/node_modules/.ngcc_lock_file.)
```

> `ngcc` output after already being ran pre-build
```
Debug: Forking unlocker child-process
Debug: Attemping to write lock-file at [REDACTED]/node_modules/.ngcc_lock_file with PID 164615
Debug: Written lock-file at [REDACTED]/node_modules/.ngcc_lock_file with PID 164615
Debug: Running ngcc on ClusterExecutor (using 4 worker processes).
Debug: Analyzing entry-points...
Debug: Entry-point manifest found for [REDACTED]/node_modules so loading entry-point information directly.
Debug: Reading entry-points using the manifest entries took 0s.
Debug: Skipping ngx-simple-modal : fesm2015 (already compiled).
Debug: Analyzed 1 entry-points in 0s. (Total tasks: 0)
Debug: Attempting to remove lock-file at [REDACTED]/node_modules/.ngcc_lock_file.
Debug: PIDs match (164615), so removing [REDACTED]/node_modules/.ngcc_lock_file.
Debug: Run ngcc in 0s.
Debug: Starting unlocker at process 164626 on behalf of process 164615
Debug: The lock-file path is [REDACTED]/node_modules/.ngcc_lock_file
Debug: Attempting to remove lock-file at [REDACTED]/node_modules/.ngcc_lock_file.
Debug: The lock-file at [REDACTED]/node_modules/.ngcc_lock_file was already removed.
```

### Proposed solution

Some things that come to mind:

- Prevent `ngcc` from creating a lock if it has already been ran before
- Allow us to configure `ngcc` through `ng build` flags
- The `ng build --verbose` flag should give me information on `ngcc` if it gets ran

### Alternatives considered

I've tried hacking around to prevent `ngcc` from running all togther or instantly deleting the lock file it creates but all of these methods are not very maintainable or feasibile in the long run.

Issues.Title: elements: initialization time of the components increases parabolically as the number of components grows
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

elements

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When there are many Web Components on a page, there is a significant performance hit during the initialization of their input properties. The diagram below compares the initialization time of regular Angular Components and Angular Web Components (created with `createCustomElement`):

![ng-vs-webng](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37049940/231410947-125e53f0-9360-40fe-9a46-0dc142691b90.png)
_Measurements were taken on test site (see link to minimal reproduction)_

The problem is with the default transformation strategy (`ComponentNgElementStrategy`). It schedules change detection when setting the input property for each component. `requestAnimationFrame` is used for scheduling. Since `requestAnimationFrame` is called for each component, this results in <var>n</var> ticks, and for each tick, change detection is triggered in <var>n</var> web components (n^2).

### Possible solution:
A possible solution is to make one common `requestAnimationFrame` for all web components. I wrote a [custom strategy](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nn5ec8?file=src/element-strategy/component-factory-custom-strategy.ts) using this approach and the performance increased significantly (although it is still worse than in regular angular components):

![web-vs-customweb](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37049940/231425960-1188139e-c618-45f9-85b6-af140c5d4bf4.png)

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nn5ec8?file=src/element-strategy/component-factory-custom-strategy.ts

Issues.Title: Backward-referenced transplanted views and ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush are not fully supported
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Transplanted views (templates that are rendered into a different component than where they are declared) do not function properly when the declaration occurs _after_ the insertion point in the change detector tree.

They almost always require `checkNoChanges` to be disabled, or else they will throw an `ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError`.  This happens when the inserted view is not dirty, so it is skipped during `detectChanges`,  but then the declaration-owning view _is_ checked, which calls `markTransplantedViewsForRefresh`.

On the following `checkNoChanges` run, it _will_ check the transplanted view, which means any binding expression change will result in a `ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError`.

To reproduce:
Remove the `false` from the `fixture.detectChanges` [here (line 403)](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/f9b821f07d8dba57a6a7e5fc127dc096247424aa/packages/core/test/acceptance/change_detection_transplanted_view_spec.ts#L403).https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/f9b821f07d8dba57a6a7e5fc127dc096247424aa/packages/core/test/acceptance/change_detection_transplanted_view_spec.ts#L403

Angular 14

### Description

I'm trying to build an Angular 15 project in Docker, but with CLI analytics enabled, the build always hangs at the RUN npm run build step and never completes.

See minimal reproduction here:
https://github.com/KevinDufendach/ng-15-docker-build-issue

```
docker build .
```

`Dockerfile`
```
FROM node:16-alpine as builder

COPY package.json package-lock.json ./
RUN npm set strict-ssl false
RUN npm ci && mkdir /app && mv ./node_modules ./app
WORKDIR /app
COPY . /app/

RUN npm run build # Builds successfully but never moves to next step
```

This can be fixed by setting the "cli" analytics to "false":

`angular.json`
```
"cli": {
  "analytics": false,
},

Issues.Title: bug(material/dialog): sometimes afterClosed() is fired twice on slow PC on v14
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

13

### Description

On Slow PC, it is possible that `.afterClosed()` will be fired twice when you have `detectChanges` inside subscribe.

StackBlitz URL: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rro47p
Screenshot when reproduced:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4789526/231143123-19eb974a-270b-4000-b209-1546e9afd01a.png)

From the screenshot above, we can see that sometimes it is possible that .afterClosed() will emit into .subscribe twice.
I was not able to reproduce it on v13 and v15, but actively looking for workarounds or patches on v14.

Originally, it was reproduced on the real application after upgrading to v14, but it was very hard to catch. Lately, we noticed that in real applications it is easily reproducible when you start resource-consuming tasks on your PC.

StackBlitz example is lightweight, so I had to use CpuKiller 3 application to slow down my CPU enough to reproduce it. I'm able to reproduce it fairly stable when slowdown CPU to 80+%. When I set 98%, I'm able to reproduce it every time.


After some investigation with logpoints I was able to find that in `cdk/dialog/dialog-ref` it is somehow possible, that `closedSubject.complete()` will not be called immediately after `closedSubject.next(result)`, so 2 different flows are able to execute `next` before subject is completed.
See code that I'm referring above: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/cdk/dialog/dialog-ref.ts#L100

I get 2 fires from `material/dialog/dialog-ref`:
1. `_ref.overlayRef.detachments().subscribe` - https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/dialog/dialog-ref.ts#L93
2. ` _containerInstance._animationStateChanged` - https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/dialog/dialog-ref.ts#L87

Also, I was not able to understand why it is not reproducible on v15.

Current workarounds:
- add `pipe(take(1))` to `afterClosed` subscription - unfortunately, it requires a lot of changes over the app
- remove `detectChanges` from .subscribe, or replace with `markForCheck` - it also requires a lot of changes in the app that may break something.
- Upgrade to v15 :) - it requires upgrading everything

Any ideas of possible workarounds?

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open stackblitz URL https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rro47p
2. Slow down your CPU
3. Click on "Open dialog" and then click on "close" or outside of the modal
4. Repeat 3 several times (usually, up to 10 is enough. Sometimes you get it first time, sometimes after 9 repetitions)
5. See the console, at some moment you'll get a warning "Reproduced"


### Expected Behavior

`.afterClosed()` is emitted only once.

### Actual Behavior

`.afterClosed()` is emitted twice sometimes

Issues.Title: bug(table): Table data does not get updated when paginator pageIndex  is modified
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

On changing paginator's input property 'pageIndex', table content does not update.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a table with paginator.
2. Bind input property 'pageIndex' on paginator.
3. increment the pageIndex property.
4. Notice the table content. (Content remains on Page-1)
5. Refresh the page.
6. Click the next button of paginator.
7. Notice the table content. (Content moves to Page-2)

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-4h4jkr?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftable-overview-example.ts

### Expected Behavior

When we use table with paginator and change page by:

1. clicking next/previous button:
- paginator state updates
- table content updates

2. Updating pageIndex property
- paginator state updates
- **table content also should update**

### Actual Behavior

When we use table with paginator and change page by:

1. clicking next/previous button:
- paginator state updates
- table content updates

2. Updating pageIndex property
- paginator state updates
- **table content does not update**

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.6
- CDK/Material: 15.2.6
- Browser(s): Chrome
